page.title: 01Ganavan & Dunbeg village
page.content: This section of coastline is a raised beach and former sea levels can be seen in cliffs and caves. Major land use is rough grazing on the hill, the lower lying coastal strip devoted to intensive grazing sheep or fattening beef cattle. The hill areas are moorland-heather, deer grass, fescue and bracken with peat as substrate. Fertile areas are resown wirh sandy substrate. There is one major sandy beach of the area-a major tourist attraction. A large caravan park, car park, swing park and cafe/restaurant with seasonal childrens funfair and trampolines is situated behind the beach and residental development has sprung up with people working in Oban 2 miles away. The small village of Dunbeg to the east has a population of approx. 800 and has a general store and post office.
